result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on August 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

No contact with victim(s): A.E.D or her residence. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Shall no leave Marathon County except for purposes of work. Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept. Turn in passport to Marathon County Clerk of Court.

Clerk: Heather. 
Case called: 2:40 p.m. 

State appears by ADA Alex Lech for ADA Jonathan Barnett.  Defendant appears in person with Atty Brian Severson.

Date and time set for initial appearance. VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 
Prelim Time Limits Preserved.

COURT ORDERS: $25,000.00 signature bond.

- Shall not leave Marathon Co except for purposes of work.
- Prints and photograph. 
- Turn in passport to Marathon Co Clerk of Court.
